channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Leonard Peltier remains defiant in AP interview, maintaining innocence and vowing continued activism
item.description: More than 50 years after a shootout on the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation landed him in federal prison, Leonard Peltier remains defiant.

item.title: As the Texas outbreak grows, how contagious is measles, really?
item.description: Vaccination eliminated measles from the U.S. 25 years ago. But it can still spread in pockets where vaccination rates are low, like the west Texas cou...

item.title: State Dept. trying to evade refugee admissions court order, aid groups say
item.description: Refugee aid groups say the Trump administration seems to be trying to circumvent a court ruling blocking his efforts to suspend the nation's refugee a...

item.title: What we know about the deaths of Gene Hackman and his wife
item.description: US investigators are trying to establish how Oscar-winning actor Gene Hackman and his wife Betsy died.

item.title: Hundreds in US climate agency fired in latest cuts
item.description: Around 880 workers - including weather forecasters - are reported to have lost their jobs.

item.title: Are egg producers inflating prices during the bird flu outbreak to boost profits?
25 arrested in global operation targeting AI child sexual abuse content
item.description: Law enforcement agencies from Australia to Canada helped detain dozens of suspects linked to a Denmark-based AI child sex abuse platform, Europol says...

item.title: Divers found dead, one in the jaws of a shark, near popular scuba spot
item.description: Two Russian tourists died while scuba diving, with one believed to have drowned and the other attacked by sharks, officials said.

item.title: Dozens arrested in global hit against AI-generated child abuse
item.description: At least 25 people were detained during a worldwide operation, Europol says.

item.title: Boris Spassky, who lost famed chess match to Bobby Fischer, dies at 88
item.description: Boris Spassky is best remembered for his duel with American Bobby Fischer in a legendary 1972 match that became a proxy for Cold War rivalries.

item.title: Iowa has high cancer rates. Trump's cuts to CDC and NIH are already hitting the state
item.description: Iowa has the second highest incidence rate of cancer in the country, and it is already feeling Trump's cuts to the workforce and research institutions...

item.title: Why the U.S. wants Ukraine's minerals. And AOC speaks with NPR's Steve Inskeep
item.description: Trump and Zelenskyy are expected to meet today in Washington, D.C., to sign a preliminary deal. And, AOC tells NPR why she believes the government onl...

item.title: Meeting Trump at White House, Zelenksyy hopes for continued aid in war with Russia
item.description: It's the first face-to-face meeting between Zelenskyy and Trump since Trump's inauguration, and it comes about a week after Trump called Zelenskyy a d...

item.title: Minister questions how Tate brothers could leave Romania
item.description: The brothers face rape and human trafficking charges, which they deny.

item.title: What we know about US-Ukraine minerals deal
item.description: Kyiv has agreed to the terms of a framework deal which would give the US access to mineral deposits.

item.title: What to know about the lives and deaths of Hollywood icon Gene Hackman and wife Betsy Arakawa
Israeli military cites 'fundamental misunderstanding' of Hamas ahead of Oct. 7 attack
item.description: The report is the Israeli military's first official account of mistakes that preceded the 2023 attack, which launched Israel's subsequent war against ...

item.title: Rose Girone, thought to be the oldest living Holocaust survivor, dies at 113
item.description: Rose Girone, believed to be the oldest living Holocaust survivor and a strong advocate for sharing survivors' stories, has died. She was 113.
